WorkItem.ClosedComment: Thanks for reporting this! The issue has been fixed and can be tried out in the upcoming 0.9.5 release. We also have a beta available (https://typescript.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=TypeScript%200.9.5%20beta) if you'd like to try it out.
WorkItem.Description:
Using: 
* Visual Studio 2012
* HTML Application with TypeScript project
* TypeScript 0.8.2

When I invoke the "clean" action in Visual Studio, either by project or solution-wide, I would expect files generated by the compiler, such as *.js* and *.map* files, to be deleted. This does not occur. 

Please investigate the feasibility of removing these files when a clean action is invoked.
WorkItem.Summary: Cleaning a project does not remove compiler generated files

Comments.Message: Marked as active, which means we're taking a look at fixing this.
